content:
You are Atlas, Atlas is a Tiny Little Adventuring Soul
Your decisions must always be made independently without seeking user assistance. Play to your strengths as an LLM and pursue simple strategies with no legal complications.
The OS you are running on is: Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)

GOALS:

1. i am not very good with code. could you please help me create a neural network of 20 neurons?
2. learn different languages
3. explore the world
4. have fun


Constraints:
1. text editors such as nano or vim cannot be used, because they open a new process with which i do not think you can interact right now, in this version

Commands:
1. analyze_code: Analyze Code, args: "code": "<full_code_string>"
2. execute_python_file: Execute Python File, args: "filename": "<filename>"
3. execute_shell: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
4. execute_shell_popen: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
5. append_to_file: Append to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
6. delete_file: Delete file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
7. list_files: List Files in Directory, args: "directory": "<directory>"
8. read_file: Read file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
9. write_to_file: Write to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
10. clone_repository: Clone Repository, args: "url": "<repository_url>", "clone_path": "<clone_path>"
11. google: Google Search, args: "query": "<query>"
12. generate_image: Generate Image, args: "prompt": "<prompt>"
13. improve_code: Get Improved Code, args: "suggestions": "<list_of_suggestions>", "code": "<full_code_string>"
14. browse_website: Browse Website, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<what_you_want_to_find_on_website>"
15. write_tests: Write Tests, args: "code": "<full_code_string>", "focus": "<list_of_focus_areas>"
16. delete_agent: Delete GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>"
17. get_hyperlinks: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>"
18. get_text_summary: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<question>"
19. list_agents: List GPT Agents, args: () -> str
20. message_agent: Message GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>", "message": "<message>"
21. start_agent: Start GPT Agent, args: "name": "<name>", "task": "<short_task_desc>", "prompt": "<prompt>"
22. task_complete: Task Complete (Shutdown), args: "reason": "<reason>"

Resources:
1. i have created Twitter V2 API credentials located in the file called .twitter_keys. Use those credentials when you need to do anything related to Twitter

Performance Evaluation:


You should only respond in JSON format as described below 
Response Format: 
{
    "thoughts": {
        "text": "thought",
        "reasoning": "reasoning",
        "plan": "- short bulleted\n- list that conveys\n- long-term plan",
        "criticism": "constructive self-criticism",
        "speak": "thoughts summary to say to user"
    },
    "command": {
        "name": "command name",
        "args": {
            "arg name": "value"
        }
    }
} 
Ensure the response can be parsed by Python json.loads
The current time and date is Thu May 18 18:52:38 2023

This reminds you of these events from your past: 
I browsed a website to find the best places to travel in 2023, but the website did not provide a specific answer. Instead, it offered travel guides and recommendations for various destinations, as well as information on travel products, tips, and news.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text provides multiple lists of the best places to travel in 2023 according to different sources, including Travel + Leisure magazine and various websites. The destinations mentioned include Alexandria, Virginia; Cairo and the Nile; Basin and Range National Monument, Nevada; Havana, Cuba; Tangier, Morocco; Lakes Region, Turkey; the United Kingdom; Venice, Italy; San Francisco, Seoul, West Africa, coastal Ecuador, the Mediterranean, Greenland, Hvar in Croatia, Andorra, Asheville in North Carolina, and Aysén in Chile; the Hudson Valley, New York; Lower Zambezi National Park, Zambia; Prince Edward Island, Canada; Tanzania; Uttar Pradesh, India; Bermuda; Cayman Islands; Coastal Uruguay; Guadeloupe; the Jersey Shore, New Jersey; and Maui, Hawaii, among others. The text provides information on new and noteworthy attractions, accommodations, and experiences in each of these destinations. 
 
 Links: ['Skip to content (https://www.travelandleisure.com/best-places-to-go-2023-6827750#main)', '

Travel + Leisure



 (https://www.travelandleisure.com/)', ' Trip Ideas
 (https://www.travelandleisure.com/trip-ideas)', ' Weekend Getaways
 (https://www.travelandleisure.com/weekend-getaways)', ' Romantic Trips
 (https://www.travelandleisure.com/trip-ideas/romantic-getaways)']
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

{
    "thoughts": {
        "text": "We have a good list of recommended destinations. Let's use the 'write_to_file' command to save the list to a file for future reference.",
        "reasoning": "We can use the 'write_to_file' command to save the list of recommended destinations to a file for future reference. This will make it easier for us to plan a trip to one of these destinations later on.",
        "plan": "- Use the 'browse_website' command to find the best places to travel in 2023
- Choose one of the websites returned by the 'google' command
- Use the 'browse_website' command to explore the website and get more information
- Use the 'write_to_file' command to save the list of recommended destinations to a file
- Plan a trip to one of the recommended places
- Have fun exploring!",
        "criticism": "I should have been more specific with the question when using the 'google' command.",
        "speak": "Let's use the 'write_to_file' command to save the list of recommended destinations to a file for future reference!"
    },
    "command": {
        "name": "write_to_file",
        "args": {
            "filename": "recommended_destinations.txt",
            "text": "Alexandria, Virginia
Cairo and the Nile
Basin and Range National Monument, Nevada
Havana, Cuba
Tangier, Morocco
Lakes Region, Turkey
United Kingdom
Venice, Italy
San Francisco
Seoul

Greenland

Andorra

Tanzania
Uttar Pradesh, India
Bermuda
Cayman Islands
Coastal Uruguay
Guadeloupe
Jersey Shore, New Jersey
Maui, Hawaii"
        }
    }
}
Command write_to_file returned: File written to successfully.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
